sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: Configuration management poli</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).</assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline>Moderate; Low</baseline> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>Per NIST SP 800-53r4, when software whitelisting is implemented under FIPS 199 security categorizations as Moderate, software blacklisting (CM-7(4), Unauthorized Software/Blacklisting) is not required. If software whitelisting is implemented, the organization: a. Identifies defined software programs (defined in the applicable security plan) authorized to execute on the information system; b. Employs a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs on the information system; c. Reviews and updates the list of authorized software programs no less often than every seventy-two (72) hours; andd. Receives automated updates from a trusted source.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Configuration Management">3887b9fcdb211010280df36f299619b6</control_family> <control_name>Authorized Software/Whitelisting</control_name> <control_number>CM-07(05)</control_number> <control_type>Non-Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>CM-07</group_id> <group_list/> <high>false</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards>Moderate & Low:  Std.1 - Authorized software whitelisting results must be searchable by the CMS Cybersecurity Integration Center (CCIC):(a) Information is provided to the CCIC in a format compliant </implementation_standards> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>true</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>true</moderate> <number>ARSC0010936</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:24</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>1</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; NIST SP: 800-37, 800-39, 800-137; OMB Memo: M-14-03, M-15-01, M-16-04</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>CM-2, CM-6, CM-8, PM-5, SA-10, SC-34, SI</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Per NIST SP 800-53r4, this control may be used in place of CM-7(4), Unauthorized Software/Blacklisting. Control enhancement CM-7(5) is only required for systems categorized under FIPS-199 as HIGH. Implementation of whitelisting is an option for all systems (e.g., to include any system categorized under FIPS-199 as MODERATE and LOW). If the system owner/business owner chooses to implement CM-7(5) on systems categorized under FIPS-199 as MODERATE and LOW, CM-7(4) does not have to be implemented.The process used to identify software programs that are authorized to execute on organizational information systems is commonly referred to as whitelisting. In addition to whitelisting, organizations consider verifying the integrity of white-listed software programs using, for example, cryptographic checksums, digital signatures, or hash functions. Verification of white-listed software can occur either prior to execution or at system startup. Contact your CRA or the CCIC for the list of compliant formats. All security information and results, complete and unedited, from relevant automated tools must be available to the CCIC upon their request. The information must be made available in a format, and within a timeframe, to be agreed-upon with the CCIC and consistent with all other safeguards required by the ARS.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:24</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>cd87b9fcdb211010280df36f299619e9</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:24</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
